Headline: Nixon and Kissinger on China
Text: Nixon and Henry Kissinger discuss a potential diplomatic opening to China. The conversation shows early Cold War repositioning.

Headline: Watergate Enters the Room
Text: Nixon and John Dean have an early conversation about the developing Watergate investigation, reflecting growing concern about legal exposure.
Media Caption: The Watergate complex, site of the infamous break-in.

Headline: Hush Money and Loyalty
Text: Nixon, Haldeman, and Ziegler discuss loyalty, media fallout, and hush money. This is a key moment revealing Nixon’s deep involvement in the cover-up.
Media Caption: Nixon under pressure during the Watergate unraveling.

Headline: Tape Integrity and Leaks
Text: Nixon talks with Buzhardt, Ziegler, and Kissinger about controlling leaks and the threat posed by taped conversations. The anxiety about tapes is now central.
Media Caption: Diagram of the Nixon White House taping system.

Headline: The Final Tape
Text: The last known recorded conversation. Nixon gives final messaging instructions as the Watergate crisis reaches its peak.
Media Caption: Nixon’s exit begins to take shape.

Headline: Nixon Resigns
Text: Nixon addresses the nation, announcing his resignation following the Watergate scandal.
